result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa M Schutz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melissa M Schutz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Melissa M Schutz was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Melissa M Schutz in court with attorney Brent W. Varner.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called:  13CF199 and 14CF133.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to 13CF199.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 3 years.  $518.00 costs, includes DNA surcharge.  Submit DNA sample.  AODA and comply. 4 days jail credit.  In 14CF133 Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 3.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Cts. 1 & 2 dismissed.  Ct. 3 court sentenced defendant to serve 45 days jail with Huber work release.  $443.00 costs, includes DNA surcharge. 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Jail start  4/3/15 7:00 pm.  5 days jail credit.  Bond on hand to be applied towards costs.
